page.title: 19CHILDREN'S LEISURE
page.content: All 36 Primary School children were included in this survey, although only 12 live in the block allocated.{TOYS. Largely traditional favourites: dolls (Action Men for boys), battery contro- lled model cars, teddy bears, bicycles and toy soldiers. The main innovations were computers and electronic games: 6 children had their own computers. {LEISURE ACTIVITIES.}Also traditional, involving little or no expenditure (except horse riding and swimming): fishing, train spotting, Brownies, Guides, riding bikes, playing outside, dog walking, writing stories, reading, drawing, colouring. Only swimming and plane spotting involve leaving the area. Activities may be restricted to the area by lack of transport or by children's ages (5 to 11) and the general ethos of families living, from choice or otherwise, in a rural area.
